title: Google\Cloud\Storage\Bucket
name: Bucket
description: Buckets are the basic containers that hold your data. Everything that you store in Google Cloud Storage must be contained in a bucket.

params.name: connection
params.description: Represents a connection to Cloud Storage.

params.name: name
params.description: The bucket's name.

params.name: info
params.description: The bucket's metadata.

returns.description: An ACL instance configured to handle the bucket's access control policies.

methods.name: defaultAcl
methods.description: Configure default object ACL for this bucket.

returns.description: An ACL instance configured to handle the bucket's default object access control policies.

methods.name: exists
methods.description: Check whether or not the bucket exists.

methods.name: upload
methods.description: Upload your data in a simple fashion. Uploads will default to being resumable if the file size is greater than 5mb.

examples.caption: Upload an object in a resumable fashion while setting a new name for the object and including the content language.
Upload an object with a customer-supplied encryption key.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be uploaded.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the destination. Required when data is of type string or null.

params.name: options.resumable
params.description: Indicates whether or not the upload will be performed in a resumable fashion.

params.name: options.validate
params.description: Indicates whether or not validation will be applied using md5 hashing functionality. If true and the calculated hash does not match that of the upstream server the upload will be rejected.

params.name: options.chunkSize
params.description: If provided the upload will be done in chunks. The size must be in multiples of 262144 bytes. With chunking you have increased reliability at the risk of higher overhead. It is recommended to not use chunking.

params.name: options.uploadProgressCallback
params.description: If provided together with $resumable == true the given callable function/method will be called after each successfully uploaded chunk. The callable function/method will receive the number of uploaded bytes after each uploaded chunk as a parameter to this callable. It's useful if you want to create a progress bar when using resumable upload type together with $chunkSize parameter. If $chunkSize is not set the callable function/method will be called only once after the successful file upload.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: The available options for metadata are outlined at the JSON API docs.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

methods.name: getResumableUploader
methods.description: Get a resumable uploader which can provide greater control over the upload process. This is recommended when dealing with large files where reliability is key.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be uploaded.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the destination. Required when data is of type string or null.

params.name: options.validate
params.description: Indicates whether or not validation will be applied using md5 hashing functionality. If true and the calculated hash does not match that of the upstream server the upload will be rejected.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: The available options for metadata are outlined at the JSON API docs.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

params.name: options.uploadProgressCallback
params.description: The given callable function/method will be called after each successfully uploaded chunk. The callable function/method will receive the number of uploaded bytes after each uploaded chunk as a parameter to this callable. It's useful if you want to create a progress bar when using resumable upload type together with $chunkSize parameter. If $chunkSize is not set the callable function/method will be called only once after the successful file upload.

methods.name: getStreamableUploader
methods.description: Get a streamable uploader which can provide greater control over the upload process. This is useful for generating large files and uploading the contents in chunks.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be uploaded.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.name
params.description: The name of the destination. Required when data is of type string or null.

params.name: options.validate
params.description: Indicates whether or not validation will be applied using md5 hashing functionality. If true and the calculated hash does not match that of the upstream server the upload will be rejected.

params.name: options.chunkSize
params.description: If provided the upload will be done in chunks. The size must be in multiples of 262144 bytes. With chunking you have increased reliability at the risk of higher overhead. It is recommended to not use chunking.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: The available options for metadata are outlined at the JSON API docs.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

methods.name: object
methods.description: Lazily instantiates an object. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on an object please see Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the object to request.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.generation
params.description: Request a specific revision of the object.

params.name: options.encryptionKey
params.description: A base64 encoded AES-256 customer-supplied encryption key. It will be neccesary to provide this when a key was used during the object's creation.

params.name: options.encryptionKeySHA256
params.description: Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. This value will be calculated from the encryptionKey on your behalf if not provided, but for best performance it is recommended to pass in a cached version of the already calculated SHA.

examples.caption: Get all objects beginning with the prefix 'photo'

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.delimiter
params.description: Returns results in a directory-like mode. Results will contain only objects whose names, aside from the prefix, do not contain delimiter. Objects whose names, aside from the prefix, contain delimiter will have their name, truncated after the delimiter, returned in prefixes. Duplicate prefixes are omitted.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per request. Defaults to 1000.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

params.name: options.prefix
params.description: Filter results with this prefix.

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either "full" or "noAcl".

params.name: options.versions
params.description: If true, lists all versions of an object as distinct results. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.fields
params.description: Selector which will cause the response to only return the specified fields.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: If set, only deletes the bucket if its metageneration matches this value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: If set, only deletes the bucket if its metageneration does not match this value.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update the bucket. Upon receiving a result the local bucket's data will be updated.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the bucket. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.predefinedDefaultObjectAcl
params.description: Apply a predefined set of default object access controls to this bucket. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either "full" or "noAcl".

params.name: options.fields
params.description: Selector which will cause the response to only return the specified fields.

params.name: options.acl
params.description: Access controls on the bucket.

params.name: options.cors
params.description: The bucket's Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) configuration.

params.name: options.defaultObjectAcl
params.description: Default access controls to apply to new objects when no ACL is provided.

params.name: options.lifecycle
params.description: The bucket's lifecycle configuration.

params.name: options.logging
params.description: The bucket's logging configuration, which defines the destination bucket and optional name prefix for the current bucket's logs.

params.name: options.storageClass
params.description: The bucket's storage class. This defines how objects in the bucket are stored and determines the SLA and the cost of storage. Acceptable values include "MULTI_REGIONAL", "REGIONAL", "NEARLINE", "COLDLINE", "STANDARD" and "DURABLE_REDUCED_AVAILABILITY".

params.name: options.versioning
params.description: The bucket's versioning configuration.

params.name: options.website
params.description: The bucket's website configuration.

params.name: options.billing
params.description: The bucket's billing configuration. Whitelist Warning: At the time of publication, this argument is subject to a feature whitelist and may not be available in your project.

params.name: options.billing['requesterPays']
params.description: When true, requests to this bucket and objects within it must provide a project ID to which the request will be billed. Whitelist Warning: At the time of publication, this argument is subject to a feature whitelist and may not be available in your project.

params.name: options.labels
params.description: The Bucket labels. Labels are represented as an array of keys and values. To remove an existing label, set its value to null.

methods.name: compose
methods.description:
Composes a set of objects into a single object.

Please note that all objects to be composed must come from the same bucket.

params.name: sourceObjects
params.description: The objects to compose.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the composed object.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.predefinedAcl
params.description: Predefined ACL to apply to the composed object. Acceptable values include, "authenticatedRead", "bucketOwnerFullControl", "bucketOwnerRead", "private", "projectPrivate", and "publicRead".

params.name: options.metadata
params.description: Metadata to apply to the composed object. The available options for metadata are outlined at the JSON API docs.

params.name: options.ifGenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current generation matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the operation conditional on whether the object's current metageneration matches the given value.

methods.name: info
methods.description: Retrieves the bucket's details. If no bucket data is cached a network request will be made to retrieve it.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either "full" or "noAcl".

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Triggers a network request to reload the bucket's details.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration matches the given value.

params.name: options.ifMetagenerationNotMatch
params.description: Makes the return of the bucket metadata conditional on whether the bucket's current metageneration does not match the given value.

params.name: options.projection
params.description: Determines which properties to return. May be either "full" or "noAcl".

methods.name: isWritable
methods.description:
Returns whether the bucket with the given file prefix is writable.

Tries to create a temporary file as a resumable upload which will not be completed (and cleaned up by GCS).

params.name: file
params.description: File to try to write.

methods.name: iam
methods.description:
Manage the IAM policy for the current Bucket.

Please note that this method may not yet be available in your project.
